Package dev.sergiferry.playernpc.api

Class NPC

java.lang.Object
dev.sergiferry.playernpc.api.NPC
public class NPC extends Object
NPC instance per player. An NPC can only be seen by one player. This is because of personalization purposes. With this instance you can create customizable Player NPCs that can be interacted with. NPCs will be only visible to players after creating the EntityPlayer, and show it to the player.
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • create

      public NPC create()
      Creates the entityPlayer of the NPC, but it doesn't show it to the player until show().
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if skin equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals true because it means that the entityPlayer is created yet.
      See Also:
      show()

    • update

      public NPC update()
      Updates the attributes of the NPC. Some changes will need forceUpdate()
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      See Also:
      update(), forceUpdate()

    • forceUpdate

      public NPC forceUpdate()
      Re-creates the entityPlayer, and updates all the attributes. This is useful after doing some big changes to the NPC, like setting the skin, glowing color, or collision rule. Methods that require this force update will be documented. Otherwise use update()
      Returns:
      The NPC instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if player equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      See Also:
      create(), isCreated(), update()

    • teleport

      public NPC teleport​(double x, double y, double z, float yaw, float pitch)
      Teleports entityPlayer to the specified coordinate. This method automatically updates to the Player client.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate
      z - Z coordinate
      yaw - Yaw horizontal
      pitch - Pitch vertical
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      See Also:
      isCreated(), teleport(Entity), teleport(Location), teleport(double, double, double)

    • teleport

      public NPC teleport​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Teleports entityPlayer to Entity.getLocation() This method automatically updates to the Player client.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity that will teleport to.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if Entity.getWorld() is different of getWorld()
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      See Also:
      isCreated(), teleport(Location), teleport(double, double, double), teleport(double, double, double, float, float)

    • teleport

      public NPC teleport​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.Location location)
      Teleports entityPlayer to the specified Location. This method automatically updates to the Player client.
      Parameters:
      location - The location that will teleport to.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if 's Location.getWorld() is not the same as world
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      See Also:
      isCreated()

    • teleport

      public NPC teleport​(double x, double y, double z)
      Teleports entityPlayer to the specified coordinate. This method automatically updates to the Player client.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate
      z - Z coordinate
      Returns:
      the NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      See Also:
      isCreated()

    • setItem

      public NPC setItem​(@Nonnull NPCSlot slot, @Nullable org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemStack)
      Sets the equipment of the NPC with the ItemStack at the specified NPCSlot. If isCreated(), you must use update() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot that the item will be equipped.
      itemStack - The itemStack that will be equipped.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if slot equals null
      See Also:
      update(), updateEquipment()

    • clearEquipment

      public NPC clearEquipment​(@Nonnull NPCSlot slot)
      Clears the equipment of the NPC at the specified NPCSlot If isCreated(), you must use update() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot that will be cleared.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if slot equals null
      See Also:
      update()

    • clearEquipment

      public NPC clearEquipment()
      Clears the equipment of the NPC If isCreated(), you must use update() to show it to the Player
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      See Also:
      update()

    • updateText

      public NPC updateText()
      Updates the npcHologram. If the amount of lines is different at the previous text, use forceUpdateText()
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      See Also:
      forceUpdateText()

    • forceUpdateText

      public NPC forceUpdateText()
      Re-creates the npcHologram. If the amount of lines is the same as the previous text, use updateText()
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      See Also:
      updateText()

    • destroy

      public NPC destroy()
      Destroys the NPC, and can be created after. To definitely destroy and remove the NPC instance use NPCLib.removeNPC(Player, NPC)
      Returns:
      The NPC instance
      See Also:
      NPCLib.removeNPC(Player, NPC), NPCLib.removeNPC(Player, String)

    • show

      public NPC show()
      Shows the NPC to the player. It must be isCreated() to show it. To hide it after, use hide(). This method calls NPCShowEvent.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if getPlayer() equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      See Also:
      isCreated(), create(), hide()

    • hide

      public NPC hide()
      Hides the NPC from the player. It must be isCreated() to hide it. To show it again, use show(). This method calls NPCHideEvent.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if getPlayer() equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      See Also:
      isCreated(), create(), show()

    • lookAt

      public NPC lookAt​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)

    • lookAt

      public NPC lookAt​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.Location location)

    • setHideText

      public NPC setHideText​(boolean b)
      Hides or shows the text above the NPC, but without losing the text information.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.

    • setCollidable

      public NPC setCollidable​(boolean collidable)
      Sets whether the NPC is collidable or not. If isCreated(), you must use forceUpdate() to show it to the Player
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      See Also:
      forceUpdate()
